scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection contains an electrostatic copy of the appointment of Philip St. George Cockeas aide-de-camp to the Commander in Chief with the rank of Colonel of Cavalry, signed by Governor John B. Floyd, February 22, 1850, and the seven page manuscript of a poem by Margaret Read Cabellentitled, "Stanzas addressed to Philip St. George Cocke Esq on entering his newly-erected mansion at Belmead, Powhatan, June 1848." Margaret Read (Venable) Cabellwas the wife of Nicholas Cabell, Jr. and mother of Nathaniel Francis Cabell. Also present is a typescript of Mrs. Cabell's poem by John Page Elliott.
